actions.id: Give ORS. Help caregiver give child ORS solution in front of you until child is no longer thirsty.
Give caregiver 2 ORS packets to take home.
Advise to give as much as child wants, but at least ½ cup ORS solution after each loose stool
Give zinc supplement. Give 1 dose daily for 10 days: Age 2 months up to 6 months - ½ tablet (total 5 tablets)
Help caregiver to give first dose now.
Give ORS. Help caregiver give child ORS solution in front of you until child is no longer thirsty.
Give caregiver 2 ORS packets to take home.
Advise to give as much as child wants, but at least ½ cup ORS solution after each loose stool
Give zinc supplement. Give 1 dose daily for 10 days: Age 6 months up to 5 years - 1 tablet (total 10 tablets)
Help caregiver to give first dose now.
Prepare ORS solution: 1. Wash your hands with soap and water.
Prepare ORS solution: 2. Pour the entire contents of a packet of ORS into a clean container for mixing the ORS. The container should be large enough to hold at least 1 litre.
Prepare ORS solution: 3. Measure 1 litre of clean water (or correct amount for packet used). Use the cleanest drinking water available.
Prepare ORS solution: 4. Pour the water into the container. Mix well until the salts completely dissolve.

advice: For ALL children treated at home: advise on home care
Breastfeed more frequently during illness including diarrhoea
Increase the frequency of breastfeeding and breastfeed for longer at each feed
Give only breast milk and medicines recommended by your doctor/ health care provider
Do not give any throat or cough remedy
If your baby refuses to breastfeed, encourage your baby until he or she takes the breast again
If the baby is too weak to suckle, express breast milk to give the baby
When you are sick, you can continue to breastfeed your baby
For children who are not exclusively breastfed, give clean water and more fluid foods
The child with diarrhoea should also take ORS solution
